alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Seminole County through 545 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oviedo, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sanford, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Casselberry and Lake Mary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
